name: Ammoniacum dorema
Relationship: Antidotes: Bry.; Arnica.Compare: Senega.; Tart. emet.; Balsam Peru.

Eyes: Stars and fiery points float before eyes
Respiratory: Large accumulation of purulent matter and feeble expectoration; worse cold weather
Heart beats stronger, extends to pit of stomach
Coarse rattling of chest in old people
Head: Catarrhal headache due to closure of frontal sinuses
Throat: Throat dry; worse inhaling fresh air
Full feeling, burning and scraping sensation
Immediately after eating, sensation as if something stuck in oesophagus, causing swallowing

details: A remedy for the aged and feeble, especially in chronic bronchitis. Ill humor. Sensitive to cold. Sensation of burning and scratching in neck and oesophagus.
